intro: Veronica afrochamaedrys, commonly known as the African speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
